org.gradoop.flink.algorithms.gelly.randomjump

Class KRandomJumpGellyVCI<G extends GraphHead,V extends Vertex,E extends Edge,LG extends BaseGraph<G,V,E,LG,GC>,GC extends BaseGraphCollection<G,V,E,LG,GC>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gradoop.flink.algorithms.gelly.BaseGellyAlgorithm<G,V,E,LG,GC,Long,VCIVertexValue,Long,LG>
      • org.gradoop.flink.algorithms.gelly.randomjump.KRandomJumpGellyVCI<G,V,E,LG,GC>
  • Type Parameters:
    G - Gradoop graph head type.
    V - Gradoop vertex type.
    E - Gradoop edge type.
    LG - Gradoop type of the graph.
    GC - Gradoop type of the graph collection.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Operator, UnaryBaseGraphToBaseGraphOperator<LG>, UnaryBaseGraphToValueOperator<LG,LG>

    public class KRandomJumpGellyVCI<G extends GraphHead,V extends Vertex,E extends Edge,LG extends BaseGraph<G,V,E,LG,GC>,GC extends BaseGraphCollection<G,V,E,LG,GC>>
extends BaseGellyAlgorithm<G,V,E,LG,GC,Long,VCIVertexValue,Long,LG>
implements UnaryBaseGraphToBaseGraphOperator<LG>
    Performs the RandomJump using Gellys VertexCentricIteration (VCI). Uniformly at random picks numberOfStartVertices starting vertices and then simulates a RandomWalk for each starting vertex on the graph, where once visited edges are not used again. For each walker, with a given jumpProbability, or if the walk ends in a sink, or if all outgoing edges of the current vertex were visited, randomly jumps to any vertex in the graph and starts a new RandomWalk from there. Unlike the RandomWalk algorithm, RandomJump does not have problems of getting stuck or not being able to visit enough vertices. The algorithm converges when the maximum number of iterations has been reached, or enough vertices have been visited (with the percentage of vertices to visit at least given in percentageToVisit). Returns the initial graph with vertices and edges annotated by a boolean property named "sampled", which is set to true if visited, or false if not.

        Creates an instance of KRandomJumpGellyVCI.
        Parameters:
        numberOfStartVertices - Number of starting vertices.
        maxIterations - Value for maximum number of iterations for the algorithm.
        jumpProbability - Probability for jumping to random vertex instead of walking to random neighbor.
        percentageToVisit - Relative amount of vertices to visit at least.
